p: Alternatively, reduction in the ROS activity by ROS scavenger or ROS inhibitor resulted in a higher DENV titer than the control group ( Fig 7A and 7B). These findings imply ROS was related to antivirus immunity. ROS is also a major anti-pathogenic molecule induced by pulmonary influenza viral infections [ 55]. In this study, the antioxidants and ROS have been found to be associated with the early stage of antiviral immunity. Accumulation of ROS induced by dsHPX8C also affects ZIKV levels in mosquitoes. Our previous report indicated that reduction of the ROS level can rescue the defect in infection of E glycosylation site deficient mutant ZIKV in the mosquito midgut [ 30]. This result provides new research clues for our research. In the future, we will explore how ROS and HPX8C affect the DENV and the molecular mechanism underlying HPX8C-mediated antiviral responses, thus providing a new theoretical basis for antiviral immunity and virus control.
